5.25 Linear Feet in 5 record cartons, 1 half manuscript box, and 1 oversize folder
1970-2013 New York City People's Life Fund and NYC War Tax Resistance were founding in 1971 by Sallie Marx in direct response to the Vietnam War. The organizations provide information, support and counseling to New Yorkers considering war tax resistance and to those involved with war tax resistance, as well as channeling resisted war tax money and contributions to communities that are underserved by government. The collection contains correspondence, pamphlets and flyers, bulletins, newsletters, grant applications and legal documents. Materials are in English. Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please contact tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.
Access Restrictions
Open to users without restrictions, with the exception of financial records in box 6, which are restricted until 2067.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Donated by the New York City People's Life Fund and New York City War Tax Resistance in 2004. The accession number 2004.023 is associated with this gift. In 2017 the estate of Sallie Marx sent an additional three boxes NYC People's Life Fund and NYC War Tax Resistanc records. The accession number associated with this gift is 2017.017.
Arrangement
This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. Materials are in the order in which they were received from the donor.
Historical/Biographical Note
War tax resistance is a diverse movement of people who refuse to pay part or all of their federal income tax, and/or their phone tax, which is historically associated with war. New York City War Tax Resistance and the New York City People’s Life Fund were founded in 1971 by Sallie Marx in direct response to the Vietnam War. The New York City War Tax Resistance provides information, support and counseling to New Yorkers considering war tax resistance and to those involved with war tax resistance. The New York City People's Life Fund channels resisted war tax money and contributions to communities that are underserved by government.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; New York City People's Life Fund and New York City War Tax Resistance Records; TAM 299; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Processing Information
Processing decisions made prior to 2017 have not yet been recorded. In 2017, three additional boxes were added to the colleciton as boxes 3-5, and a brief box list was created for materials in the collection. This collection has not been arranged by an archivist.
Scope and Content Note
This collection contains materials related to the New York City People's Life Fund (NYC PLF), the New York City War Tax Resistance (NYC WTR), and the National War Tax Resistance Coordinating Committee (NWTRCC). The collection contains correspondence, pamphlets and flyers, bulletins, newsletters, grant applications and legal documents. There are a substantial number of copies of the bulletin "Network News," published by the National War Tax Resistance Coordinating Committee, and "Tax Talk," published by War Tax Resistance. There is also a small amount of material produced by other peace, disarmament and anti-nuclear organizations.
Three boxes of materials added to the collection in 2017 include NYC PLF and NYC WTR files of Sallie Marx. This accretion contains People's Life Fund internal notes, correspondence, reports, and resolutions; National War Tax Resistance Coordinating Committee (NWTRCC) announcements, memos, and contact lists; and war tax resistance handbooks and pamphlets. It also contains files on tax court (1970-1981), as well as clippings, flyers, and documents from tax protests (1982-2002).
Use Restrictions
Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) held by the New York City People's Life Fund and New York City War Tax Resistance Records, the creators of this collection, were transferred to New York University in 2004. Permission to publish or reproduce materials in this collection must be secured from the Tamiment Library.
